document.docAuthor: XUE, XIAO-FENG, GUO, JING-FENG & HONG, XIAO-YUE
document.masterDocTitle: Eriophyoid mites from Northeast China (Acari: Eriophyoidea)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Eriophyoid mites from Northeast China (Acari: Eriophyoidea)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Aceria tritici Shevtchenko, 1970
;
Shevtchenko et al ., 1970: 224–235
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Aceria tosichella
;
Song et al ., 2008
a: 14.

Material examined. 6 females (slide number NJAUAcariEriH17-2), from
Roegneria sp.
( Poaceae ), Jiagedaqi, Heilongjiang Province , P. R . China , 50°24'27''N , 124°06'43''E , elevation 365m , 17 July 2008 , coll. Xiao-Feng Xue, Zhen Wang & Zi-Wei Song.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 9.
Aceria tosichella Keifer, 1969
: A. Dorsal view of female; B. Ventral view of female; C. Prodorsal shield of female; D. Coxae and female genitalia.

subSubSection.paragraph:

(L.) P. B.,

(L.) Gray,
Zea mays
L. ( Poaceae ).
Distribution. Australia , China ( Gansu , Henan , Heilongjiang , Jiangsu , Jilin , Tibet , Xinjiang ), Iran , Italy , Mexico , Poland , Russia , Serbia , USA .

Note. de Lillo and Amrine (2011, unpublished data) indicate that many of host records may be accidental occurrences or may represent other mite species, especially sibling species, that were misidentified. This species occurred together with
Aculodes dubius ( Nalepa, 1891 )
species complex, rec. nov.
Skoracka et al. (2012)
used both molecular and morphological characters to reveal the
Aceria tosichella
complex.
